title: Toddler struck in home by driveby gunfire; will make full recovery
content:
GRANITE CITY — A bullet struck a 3 year old when gunshots went through the window of a Granite City home Sunday during the morning’s early hours, a Madison County Sheriff’s Office news release stated Monday.
On Jan. 3 at approximately 12:30 a.m. the Sheriff’s Office responded to a home in the 4700 block of Warnock Avenue, Granite City, in reference to a report of a child being shot. Deputies met with occupants of the home who reported an unknown person(s) fired several gunshots into the front of the residence at approximately 12:15 a.m. The 3-year-old occupant of the home was struck by one of the rounds. The child was reportedly playing on the living room floor at the time of the shooting.
The victim was transported, by family members, to an area hospital prior to the arrival of sheriff’s deputies. Deputies and investigators met with members of the family, as well as neighbors and initiated an investigation, which is ongoing. The child was treated for the gunshot wound and has been released. He is expected to make a full recovery.
Anyone having information related to this incident is asked to contact the Madison County Sheriff’s Office at one of the following numbers: Dispatch Center 618-692-4433 and/or Anonymous Tip Line 618-296-3000.
